post.body:
##  Ask DeFi websites to upload their front-end to ZeroNet or Fulcrum.trade incident will happen again ##
Some days ago fulcrum.trade get hacked (as they claimed) and lots of users lost money.
ZeroNet have these benefits over web:
1- Site contents is signed by site owner sothey would be responsible for it
2- Its decentralized nature reduce the chance of targeted stealing by site owner (e.g. stealing coins based on users race, country, sex or age. For examples I mentioned co-operation from government or telecommunication company is needed except geo-location based attack
3- Unlike app they can move their current website to ZeroNet without re-programming effort

ZeroMail is not working
Here my Twitter: @acc01969307

comment.body: If you ask how defi can steal money. It is easy, most of users don't check smart contract address. They just check website address and even if they do there is no way to sure it is same address shown to the rest
Note: above problems have solutions other than decentralization too so don't be sure that DEX(es) money pour in ZeroNet project
